com.pump.swing

Class LengthSpinner

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JSpinner
            • com.pump.swing.LengthSpinner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LengthSpinner
extends javax.swing.JSpinner
    A JSpinner that adjusts Length values.

    You can monitor the unit this spinner is currently using two ways:

    1. Add a PropertyChangeListener to this object, and listen for PROPERTY_UNIT changes. Likewise you can call putClientProperty(PROPERTY_UNIT, ...) to change the unit currently displayed.

    2. Get the SpinnerModel for this spinner, which will be a LengthSpinnerModel. This class contains methods to get and set the Length.Unit that is in use.

    See Also:
    Internationalization: Measuring Lengths, Serialized Form

      • PROPERTY_UNIT

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_UNIT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • prefs

        public static java.util.prefs.Preferences prefs
        This is where the last-used unit is stored for LengthSpinners with a shared preferenceKey. By default this value is:
        Preferences.userNodeForPackage(LengthSpinner.class)

    • Constructor Detail

      • LengthSpinner

        public LengthSpinner(double value,
                     double min,
                     double max,
                     double stepSize,
                     Length.Unit unit,
                     java.text.DecimalFormat numberFormat,
                     java.lang.String preferenceKey)
        Creates a new LengthSpinner using numbers meant for only 1 type of unit.

        This is not really recommended, unless your users have to comply with certain length restrictions. For example, if the default unit is inch and the step size is 1, then when the user increases or decreases this spinner it will always use a step size of 1 inch. So if this spinner is set to work in centimeters: then the user will see a step size of 2.54 cm.

        Parameters:
        value - the initial value
        min - the minimal value
        max - the maximum value
        stepSize - the step size
        unit - the default unit
        numberFormat - an optional format to specify how to round/display values.
        preferenceKey - an optional key to save the unit the user views this data in across sessions. If this is null, then the preferred unit is not saved between sessions. If this is non-null, then this key is used to store/retrieve the unit the user prefers for this spinner (and all other spinners that share the same key).

      • LengthSpinner

        public LengthSpinner(double value,
                     double inchMax,
                     double cmMax,
                     Length.Unit defaultUnit,
                     java.lang.String preferenceKey)
        Creates a LengthSpinner with a "standard" set of step sizes and minimums of zero.
        Parameters:
        value - the initial value, in the default unit
        inchMax - the maximum value in inches. (The maximum value for feet/yards will be computed from this value.)
        cmMax - the maximum value in centimeters. (The maximum value for other metric lengths will be computed from this value.)
        defaultUnit - the default unit to use when the preferenceKey is null or uninitialized.
        preferenceKey - an optional key to save the unit the user views this data in across sessions. If this is null, then the preferred unit is not saved between sessions. If this is non-null, then this key is used to store/retrieve the unit the user prefers for this spinner (and all other spinners that share the same key).

      • LengthSpinner

        public LengthSpinner(double value,
                     double inchMin,
                     double cmMin,
                     double inchMax,
                     double cmMax,
                     Length.Unit defaultUnit,
                     java.lang.String preferenceKey)
        Creates a LengthSpinner with a "standard" set of step sizes (each step size is 1 or .5).
        Parameters:
        value - the initial value, in the default unit
        inchMin - the minimum value in inches. (The minimum value for feet/yards will be computed from this value.)
        cmMin - the minimum value in centimeters. (The minimum value for other metric lengths will be computed from this value.)
        inchMax - the maximum value in inches. (The maximum value for feet/yards will be computed from this value.)
        cmMax - the maximum value in centimeters. (The maximum value for other metric lengths will be computed from this value.)
        defaultUnit - the default unit to use when the preferenceKey is null or uninitialized.
        preferenceKey - an optional key to save the unit the user views this data in across sessions. If this is null, then the preferred unit is not saved between sessions. If this is non-null, then this key is used to store/retrieve the unit the user prefers for this spinner (and all other spinners that share the same key).

      • LengthSpinner

        public LengthSpinner(double value,
                     java.util.Map<Length.Unit,Length> mins,
                     java.util.Map<Length.Unit,Length> maxs,
                     java.util.Map<Length.Unit,Length> stepSizes,
                     Length.Unit unit,
                     java.text.DecimalFormat numberFormat,
                     java.lang.String preferenceKey)
        Creates a new LengthSpinner.

        This is the constructor all other constructors delegate to.

        Parameters:
        value - the initial value, in the default unit.
        mins - a table of minimum values. Each entry in this table has a key/value pair of Length.Unit/Length. Depending on the unit the user is currently using, different minimums may be used. If a minimum is not defined for the current unit, then the minimum for the default unit is used. (At the very least this table must contain an entry for the default unit; an exception is thrown otherwise.)
        maxs - a table of maximum values. Each entry in this table has a key/value pair of Length.Unit/Length. Depending on the unit the user is currently using, different maximums may be used. If a maximum is not defined for the current unit, then the maximum for the default unit is used. (At the very least this table must contain an entry for the default unit; an exception is thrown otherwise.)
        stepSizes - a table of step size values. Each entry in this table has a key/value pair of Length.Unit/Length. Depending on the unit the user is currently using, different step sizes may be used. If a step size is not defined for the current unit, then the step size for the default unit is used. (At the very least this table must contain an entry for the default unit; an exception is thrown otherwise.)
        unit - the default unit to use when the preferenceKey is null or uninitialized.
        numberFormat - an optional format for the numeric part of the length.
        preferenceKey - an optional key to save the unit the user views this data in across sessions. If this is null, then the preferred unit is not saved between sessions. If this is non-null, then this key is used to store/retrieve the unit the user prefers for this spinner (and all other spinners that share the same key).

      • setColumns

        public void setColumns(int c)
        This directly sets the number of columns in the text field in the spinner editor.

        The field picks a reasonable number of default columns, but you may find it necessary to increase this in certain cases.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        This returns the number of columns the text field in the spinner editor is designed for.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.Object value,
                     boolean changeUnitsToMatchArgument)
        Sets the current value.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value.
        changeUnitsToMatchArgument - if this is false, then the units currently being used in this LengthSpinner are retained. Otherwise this spinner takes on the units of the argument.
